descriptionText: This check ensures that Amazon EC2 instances are not deployed within the default VPC (`aws_vpc.default`) in AWS environments. Default VPCs are automatically created by AWS and often have broader, pre-configured network permissions and less restrictive security controls, increasing the attack surface and risk of unauthorized access. By explicitly defining and using custom VPCs (e.g., `aws_vpc.main`), organizations can enforce tailored network segmentation and security group rules, reducing the likelihood of exploitation due to overly permissive defaults.
oldDescriptionText: EC2 Instances should not be configured under a default VPC network
